archimate:Capability.name: Security Management
archimate:Capability.documentation:
This capability encompasses the development and implementation of a comprehensive, approved information security policy, strengthened by supporting policies like an acceptable use policy. These policies are further backed by detailed standards and procedures and are communicated to all individuals with access to the organization's information and systems.
It also involves establishing a specialist information security function, led by a senior manager such as a Chief Information Security Officer, who is provided with the necessary authority and resources to execute information security-related projects, promote information security throughout the organization, and manage compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and contracts.
Additionally, this capability defines the roles and responsibilities of the wider security workforce, including those in Security Operation Centres (SOCs), contributing to the organization's information security. It also supports the security aspects of mergers and acquisitions and includes taking out cyber insurance when appropriate.
